intro: Phtheirospermum japonicum, commonly known as the Japanese starburst flower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The leaves are heart-shaped and have a soft, velvety texture.
